intro: Diplycosia malayana, commonly known as the Malay cliffbrake, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with five petals. It thrives in rocky or coastal habitats, demonstrating adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological significance in its native range.
